attributes.action: Urge India to reestablish article 370 and remove their troops in J&K
attributes.additional_details:
Article 370(1)(d) states that other provisions of the Constitution can be made applicable to J&K with such “modifications as the President may by order specify” however it requires that the President secure the concurrence of the J&K government before issuing such an order.

Taken from:
https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/opinion/three-reasons-why-the-presidential-order-on-kashmir-is-not-kosher-yet/article28836245.ece
attributes.background: India has removed Jammu and Kashmir's special status of article 370 which was part of the agreement during accession of J&K to India. The process of removal which the Indian government has taken is illegal and unconstitutional. It will lead to violence and great problems in Kashmir.
